bug.author: mhart
bug.description:
The .yalc directory has been published to npm and it takes up 60% of the tfjs module disk space. I believe I've seen this with tfjs-core in the past too â€“ I suspect it should be added to .npmignore in all tfjs projects. <denchmark-h:h4>TensorFlow.js version</denchmark-h>
1.0.0 <denchmark-h:h4>Code to reproduce the bug / link to feature request</denchmark-h>
$ npm install @tensorflow/tfjs@1.0.0 $ du -k node_modules | sort -n | tail -10 9176 node_modules/@tensorflow/tfjs/dist 16772 node_modules/@tensorflow/tfjs/.yalc/@tensorflow/tfjs-core/dist 16792 node_modules/@tensorflow/tfjs-core/dist 16796 node_modules/@tensorflow/tfjs/.yalc 16796 node_modules/@tensorflow/tfjs/.yalc/@tensorflow 16796 node_modules/@tensorflow/tfjs/.yalc/@tensorflow/tfjs-core 16812 node_modules/@tensorflow/tfjs-core 26000 node_modules/@tensorflow/tfjs 55332 node_modules/@tensorflow 56732 node_modules

comments.comment: An idea: we publish a tiny package tfjs-repo-check that makes sure the tslint.json, .npmignore, .gitignore etc are consistent across our repos. All repos depend on that package as a dev dependency, and run it on every presubmit.
+1 this is a great idea. I think we can put the script in tfjs-core since all the repos depend on it rather than making a separate repo.
